top_categories.workout_context: Monaco Gravel Race's Monaco/French Alps gravel (70%), Paved roads (30%) forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 68 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Monaco Gravel Race's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before October.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Monaco Gravel Race, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
At Monaco Gravel Race, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
121ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
8,202ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
8,202ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on monaco/French Alps—steep technical climbs. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Monaco Gravel Race. Train it until it feels boring.
68 miles on monaco/French Alps—steep technical climbs burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Smooth pedaling at 68 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.
Low-cadence force work for 8,202ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Monaco Gravel Race’s 68 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Monaco Gravel Race demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride monaco/french alps—steep technical climbs at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: monaco/french alps gravel (70%), paved roads (30%), steep climbs. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 68 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and Critical Power to prepare you for 68 miles of monaco/french alps—steep technical climbs in Monaco.
